content:
That's a great approach! Scaling back your involvement and finding a co-organizer will help you manage your time and energy more effectively. It's excellent that you're being mindful of your priorities and recognizing the importance of balancing your responsibilities.

Remember, it's okay to say no or adjust your commitments when necessary. Your triathlon training is a significant goal, and you want to make sure you're giving it the attention it deserves.

By finding a co-organizer, you'll not only share the workload but also have someone to collaborate with and bounce ideas off of. This can make the experience more enjoyable and help you build a stronger team dynamic.

Keep me updated on how your triathlon training and basketball league organizing go! If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask. You got this!
